intro: Abutilon behrianum, commonly known as the velvetleaf abutilon, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that can grow up to 3 meters in height. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are velvety to the touch, giving it its common name. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a distinctive central column. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind.

It is commonly found in tropical and subtropical regions, particularly in lowland areas with high humidity. It is also present in parts of India and the Philippines, where it is adapted to warm and moist climates. Due to its ornamental value, it has been introduced to other regions outside its native range.
